content:
PA is reviewing the trackers GF#16230 and GF#17362 and wondering if there was an intentional difference between the patient/encounter $everything operations, and the wildcard compartment (defined http://hl7.org/fhir/http.html#vsearch).
This is an example of the equivalent of $everything for a Practitioner.
http://test.fhir.org/r4/Practitioner/example/*?_format=text/xhtml
What is the purpose of the $everything operation over this?
Also, on the $everything operation we have a start/end date which is intended to cover the "care dates" not "record currency dates", should the various workgroups be defining what the relevant search parameter is on each resource to apply, or alternately could this be a common search parameter across all relevant resources.
http://hl7.org/fhir/compartmentdefinition-patient.html
$everything is different to * - the second is a search that searches cross all types that have a patient=match
$everything is the set of the resources and related resources that the server believes are appropriate

A suggestion on how to define the "care dates" for each resource type would be to modify the CompartmentDefinition to include which search parameter would be applicable for care dates in the $everything date filters (start/end parameters) and describe how ranges would handled.
That would help a lot - we recently implemented $everything and there was quite a lot of discussion / uncertainty about which dates to use and how to identify them
+1 on that, the definition of which dates to use is very unclear in some cases
